children.subject: Oh oops my bad. I meant Spring, not Fall. I edited my original post. So, I'm on the degree list for Spring 2015 currently, but I want to graduate after taking Summer 2015.
If you are graduating in at the end of the summer you are still able to walk now (since there is no summer graduation)

I don't know anything about the degree list, so I dont want to mark as answered.

But for the graduation, i you are eligible to walk if you graduate in F2014, S2015, Summer2015 or Fall 15
Meet your ESS advisor, he/she can change your graduation date right away.

history.content: Hi- please contact your ESS Adviser for details on how/when to drop from the degree list. Thanks!

Hi.

As a graduating EECS senior, I've declared my candidacy this Spring 2015 semester and will complete all the graduation requirements at the end of this term. But, if I decide that I do NOT want to graduate this term and want to graduate on Summer 2015 for some reasons, I need to submit a Drop from Degree List form to the Office of Undergraduate Advising before the end of this term which is May 8. Is this correct information?

If so, can I attend the commencement for Spring semester first and then take more classes on Summer? Is there any minimum unit requirement for summer semester? How does financial aid thing work in this case (Am I still eligible to receive grants)?

Sorry for lots of questions and thank you in advance.
history.subject: Drop from the degree list

history.content:
Hi.

As a graduating EECS senior, I've declared my candidacy this Fall 2015 semester and will complete all the graduation requirements at the end of this term. But, if I decide that I do NOT want to graduate this term and want to graduate on Summer 2015 for some reasons, I need to submit a Drop from Degree List form to the Office of Undergraduate Advising before the end of this term which is May 8. Is this correct information?

If so, can I attend the commencement for Fall semester first and then take more classes on Summer? Is there any minimum unit requirement for summer semester? How does financial aid thing work in this case (Am I still eligible to receive grants)?

Sorry for lots of questions and thank you in advance.
history.subject: Drop from the degree list
